segments.text: I notice the water first, just pouring out of the sink like a little waterfall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's amazing how the woman doesn't even seem to see it, just standing there with her plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she must be really focused on what she's doing, or maybe she's just daydreaming.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being so sneaky, taking those cookies right under her nose.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they do this sort of thing often, or if it's just a one-time thing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool, he looks like he's really stretching to reach those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope he doesn't fall, but that stool looks like it's about to tip over any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her cookie, looking so innocent.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like this whole scene is just a little slice of life, something you'd see in a movie or a book.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's like everyone is in their own little world, not noticing what's going on around them.
segments.speaker: PAR
